result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chance D. Kratochvil

records.addlTxt:
9:44 AM/Room 301. Defendant Chance D. Kratochvil in court, in custody at the Langlade County Jail.  Prosecuting attorney Kelly L Hays in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attny Adam Raabe appears for Def. via Zoom. Attny Raabe has filed legal memo for preliminary hearing; Court questions the purpose for document. Attny Raabe cannot hear. Court telephones Attny Raabe. Attny Raabe will try to call in to Zoom link by phone. Attny Raabe now prepared to proceed. Court again questions the purpose for memo. Response by Attny Raabe. State has not reviewed memo in its entirety. Court summarizes memo and his response to memo. Court questions if parties want additional time to discuss and brief this issue. Attny Raabe isn't asking for any additional time. State agreeable to go forward with PH. State asks that Court find counts transactionally related. Court reviews complaint. Court finds that counts are transactionally related. Capt. Kyle Rustick, duly sworn on oath, testifies. State rests. Attny Raabe has nothing further. Court remarks on legal memo. The Court finds there is probable cause, gives clarification to probable cause, binds over for further proceedings. State asks for arraignment at a later date. Attny Raabe indicates he intends to file motion challenging bindover, asks that arraignment be set before the assigned Judge. State notes that there has been a substitution of Judge. Court indicates Information to be filed within 30 days, will set a status hearing as a place-holder so case doesn't get lost.  Bond continues.
Status hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Legal Memo for Prelim

1:56 PM/ RM 301. Defendant Chance D. Kratochvil appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Adam Raabe in court via zoom for Chance D. Kratochvil.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Atty Raabe has received a copy of the complaint, waives reading and requests P.H. Atty Raabe has filed substitution request. Court questions substitution request, Atty. Raabe responds. Court questions if Atty Raabe would like P.H. in a timely manner, Atty Raabe confirms. Atty Raabe requests to appear via zoom for P.H. Court confirms. Bond continues.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:45 am.

1:49 PM Defendant Chance D. Kratochvil appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom. Court reviews motion filed 8-3 by defendant, as def. is moving to remove no contact provision with R.H. Def. has nothing more. State objects to bond modification.  Def. wants to be heard on bond amount and conditions.  Court reviews bond modification from June 14th. Def. gives argument on bond modification.  State objects to bond modification, RE: victim R.H., amount of cash bond, attorney request, and gives argument. Court gives ruling, heard on 3 factors of setting bond and denies bond modification RE: bond and no contact provision. Bond remains as amount and conditions. Def. may renew request with Judge Rhode.

Court calls @ 1:26 pm.  Elizabeth Gebert appears via zoom.  Defendant is in custody and via zoom. State gives facts for probable cause and possible charges Maintain/Mnf Meth, Poss of Material for Meth, Poss of Meth/Waste, Poss of THC, Poss of Illegally obtained prescription, Child Pornography & Poss of Drg Paraph. State gives bail/bond recommendation. Court advised of attorney rights. Def. heard on bond. Court questions defendant.  Court orders $20,000 cash bond with No contact with Curtis Suriano & Rebecca Holzem, No illegal use or possession of controlled substances, No contact with minors. & Not possess devices that have internet. Court will reserve right to be heard on bond @ later date. Initial appearance 4-18-22 @ 1:30.
